title: VC Daily: Venture Funding in China and India Logs Strong Growth
text:
That same month, Bengaluru, India-based Mohalla Tech raised a $502 million funding round led by Tiger Global Management and Lightspeed Venture Partners.

And now on to the news...

Top News

Etsy last month agreed to buy London-based shopping app Depop for $1.62 billion.

Buying spree. Businesses spent $1.74 trillion on mergers and acquisitions involving U.S. companies during the first six months of the year—the highest amount in more than four decades—as finance chiefs tapped into cheap funding options to acquire technologies, services and other assets, Nina Trentmann reports for CFO Journal.

Such transactions surged in value in the first six months of the year, up from $511.79 billion during the year-ago period and $1.28 trillion in the first six months of 2019, before the pandemic, according to data provider Refinitiv, which began tracking deals in 1980. The total number of deals with U.S. involvement, at 9,725, also was higher than in comparable periods in 2020 and 2019, Refinitiv said.

U.S. companies are cash-rich thanks to last year's emergency fundraising rounds and strong earnings in recent quarters, providing chief financial officers with money to fill gaps in their portfolios. Also, consumer behavior and market patterns have changed during the pandemic, forcing businesses to accelerate their transformation strategies.

34

Number of technology companies summoned by Chinese antitrust authorities in April. Ride-hailing firm Didi Global Inc . is among them. (WSJ)

A Wave of Earnings Restatements Slams a Hot Market

More than 540 companies have restated their financial accounts in the past three months, higher than every full year since 2013, to comply with a directive from Washington, new data show, The Wall Street Journal reports. The guidance from the Securities and Exchange Commission hasn't had a big impact on investors but has helped cause a big slowdown in one of the market's hottest areas. The SEC's statement targeted special-purpose acquisition companies, saying in April that some were improperly accounting for warrants. The guidance took the market by surprise, according to analysts. Issuance of SPACs has tumbled since. What's more, some SPACs used the restatements to disclose other more serious problems.

Digital Ad Opportunities and Capital Spur Investor Interest in Ad Tech

Deal activity and public offerings in the advertising and marketing technology industry are rising as the sector gets a boost from a flush of available capital and companies looking for a share of a growing digital ad business, WSJ reports.

EA, Other Videogame Companies Target Mobile Gaming

Videogame companies are increasing their financial bets on mobile games as pandemic restrictions ease and people ditch their PC and TV screens to go outside, WSJ reports. Publishers such as Electronic Arts Inc ., Take-Two Interactive Software Inc . and Zynga Inc . are snatching up mobile-gaming studios and creating new mobile titles, some of which are adaptations of popular games already playable on consoles and personal computers.

Industry News

People

European early-stage investor Balderton Capital appointed Adrian Rainey as its new operating partner. He was previously a partner in Goodwin's technology group. Last month, Balderton launched a $680 million fund to make primary growth investments.

Data storage startup Pavilion Data Systems appointed Dario Zamarian as chief executive. He previously held roles at Cisco and Dell. San Jose, Calif.-based Pavilion Data is backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins , DAG Ventures, Artiman Ventures , Taiwania Capital and RPS Ventures.

Exits

Grocery delivery startup Getir purchased online grocery startup BLOK for an undisclosed amount. Last month, Turkey-based Getir closed a $550 million Series D round, valuing the company at over $7.5 billion. The company's backers include Tiger Global Management , Sequoia Capital, Silver Lake and Mubadala Investment Co .

SparkCognition Inc., a startup developing artificial intelligence for industrial uses, acquired Maana, a digital knowledge platform company, for an undisclosed sum. Austin, Texas-based SparkCognition is backed by investors including Boeing HorizonX Ventures and March Capital. Maana's backers included Eight Square Capital, Accenture Ventures, Intel Capital , GE Ventures and Chevron Technology Ventures .

New Money

Ably, a London-based realtime edge messaging platform, closed a $70 million Series B round. Insight Partners and Dawn Capital co-led the investment, which included participation from Digital Horizon, Forward Partners and MMC Ventures .

Shogun, an ecommerce experience platform, raised $67.5 million in Series C funding. Insight Partners led the round, which included support from Initialized Capital, Accel and VMG Partners .

Noname Security, a Palo Alto, Calif.-based enterprise API security startup, landed $60 million in Series B funding led by Insight Partners.

Physna Inc., a Cincinnati-based geometric deep-learning and 3D search startup, picked up a $56 million investment. Tiger Global Management led the round, which saw participation from GV and Sequoia Capital.

Animoca Brands, a Hong Kong startup focused on bringing digital property rights to gamers through the use of blockchain and non-fungible tokens, added $50 million in funding to close its latest round with nearly $139 million. Blue Pool Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Gobi Partners , Korea Investment Partners, Liberty City Ventures , Samsung Venture Investment Corp., Scopely , Token Bay Capital, zVentures and others participated in the new tranche. Animoca's pre-money valuation is $1 billion.

Gilmour Space Technologies, an Australian rocket launch startup, secured a 61 million Australian dollar Series C investment, equivalent to about $46 million, from investors including Fine Structure Ventures, Blackbird Ventures and Main Sequence.

10club, an Indian startup that acquires, operates and grows ecommerce businesses, grabbed a $40 million seed investment. Fireside Ventures and an undisclosed investor co-led the funding, which included participation from Class 5 Global, Secocha Ventures and others.

Entera, a New York- and Houston-based platform for single-family real estate investors, snagged a $32 million Series A round. Goldman Sachs Asset Management led the investment.

Quizizz Inc., a student engagement platform, nabbed $31.5 million in Series B funding. Lead investor Tiger Global Management was joined by Nexus Venture Partners , GSV Ventures, Eight Roads Ventures and others in the round.

Agrando GmbH, a Munich-based agtech startup, raised €12 million (over $14 million) in Series A funding led by yabeo. Additional investors in the round included Sony Innovation Fund, Investbridge Capital, June Fund and JLR Star.
